messages: 32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (12:57): i have a div inside a td, (that div contains the digit '0', but only so i can see something), i set the border of the div, but all I see is the zero, not the border, does td not honor css div borders? (Camino, OS X)
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (12:57): did you set the border colour and width?
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (12:58): no, let me try to color, the width shouldn't be a problem since the div contains a character (right?)
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (12:58): erm... a width for the border
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (12:59): which is totally independant of the width of the contents
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:00): still nothing, i set border:think as well as border-width:thick
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:01): its on my local machine, i'll pastebin it
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:02): ...i have firefox developer extension, it doesn't show any red marks...that is all the validation checking i've done
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:03): that doesn't do anything, i'm not on windows btw, i'm on osx
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:04): ah.. yeah, doesn't work in Linux, either :(
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:04): well, you can still feed your pages to the w3c validator
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:05): perhaps easiest if it is quickly opened in a browser, it is the third table from the top, with bunch of zeroes in the left most column
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:06): any special reason you're using XHTML?
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:08): that could well explain why you have a whole div in a td, just to center the text
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:09): instead of simply applying a style
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:11): crap, that worked, newbie + oversimplified tool = irc spam
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:11): I really don't understand wtf DW uses XML, yet it still can't deal with basic fucking styling
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (13:12): i'm not a regular javascript/css developer (obviously), is there a better tool than DW or is it just text editing for the pros?
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (13:19): it's just one of the many vi variants
5a9f5c48597ea33efa706f9d2df628d8 (13:23): i guess the validator is thinking
1da74c06317c59f2bb0b967e2f7c0904 (13:37): is it possible to horizontaly center a div?
